page.title: 07EDUCATION- CONTINUED.
page.content: Because of the locality of the schools and the deminished rural bus services, children are taken by bus to their respective schools, this service is free if the child lives outside a statutory travelling distance of 3 miles (2 miles if under 8). A good number of children live within the 3 mile zone and therefore have to pay when they reach 8 years old. Each child travelling on a school bus requires a bus pass. The ruling regarding travel costs is the cause of much dissention. Each of the schools mentioned is co-educational, and has a parent / teacher association so that throughout the children's schooling parents have the opportunity to become more closely involved with the schools activities. Parents also have representation on the school governing bodies.
